paragraph.paragraph: This tab contains information about the available code generation options.
Here is the appearance of the Generation tab with default settings for a Build project:
The options available in this tab are as follows:

list.item: Local - All attributes (corresponding to widgets and items generated by EiffelBuild) are declared as local variables.
Attributes -- All attributes are declared as attributes of the class with the following export status:
Exported - All attributes are exported to ANY.
Export only named - Only those attributes that have been named are exported to ANY while unnaned attributes are not exported..
Export None - None of the attributes are exported.
Grouped - Should different objects of same type be declared individually, or grouped? button1: EV_BUTTON button2: EV_BUTTON button3: EV_BUTTONor button1, button2, button3: EV_BUTTON

item.paragraph: If selected, then for every feature connected to an event, code will be generated which outputs to the console, the name of the feature, and the values of all arguments.

If selected, a file named "constants.txt" is generated, containing values of all String and Integer constants, with the generated system loading the values of its constants from this file. See ../75_constants/index.xmlconstants for more information.
